On 31 Aug 02, at 9:25, Lee Roversi wrote:

>
> The "horrible" series of history, science and geography sound like
> something we need in this unschooled house - - - could not find them
> on a quick Amazon search. More info, please. Love, Lee North Country
>
Get them on Amazon.co.uk cos they are english.
Terry Deary for the Horrible History
Nick Arnold for the horrible Science

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] horrible help, please
messages.msgSnippet: ... something we need in this unschooled house - - - could not find them on a quick Amazon search. More info, please. Terry Deary wrote the Horrible
messages.messageBody:
>>The "horrible" series of history, science and geography sound like
something we need in this unschooled house - - - could not find them on a
quick Amazon search. More info, please.>>

Terry Deary wrote the Horrible Histories that we have. The titles in the
series are listed as:

The Awesome Egyptians
The Groovy Greeks
The Rotten Romans
The Vicious Vikings
The Miserable Middle Ages

Here's a link to Amazon:
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/search-handle-form/002-3101324-5289620

Looks like there's a lot more to get now including Shakepeare and Greek
Legends.

Have fun.

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] horrible help, please
messages.msgSnippet: For some reason you need to put in the author s names.  They are: Nick Arnold, Terry Deary and Anita Ganery.  Put all of those in separately.  Also, if you use
messages.messageBody:
For some reason you need to put in the author's names. They are: Nick Arnold, Terry Deary and Anita Ganery. Put all of those in separately. Also, if you use UK Amazon.com (www.amazon.co.uk) they have all of them and they are in stock. For some reason, they're harder to get at the US Amazon.

Linda
----- Original Message -----
From: Lee Roversi
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, August 31, 2002 3:25 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] horrible help, please



The "horrible" series of history, science and geography sound like
something we need in this unschooled house - - - could not find them on a
quick Amazon search. More info, please.
Love, Lee
